revised_title: An Account of the 1754 York Earthquake
tldr: The author, David Erskine Baker, describes the events and effects of an earthquake that occurred in York on April 19, 1754. The shock was felt in various locations, and its extent was traced to nearby towns such as Foforth, Bishopthorpe, Huntington, Hesslington, and Selby. The author also mentions the impact on singing birds in cages during the event.
